intro: Calceolaria truxillensis subsp. pivotiformis, commonly known as the Truxillensis slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its distinctive calyces that resemble small slippers, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, such as rocky slopes and grasslands, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers, which are usually violet or purple in color, bloom during the spring and summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
